Articles.Content:
I'll call my first interstellar spaceship Order of Magnitude.

As in that an interstellar voyage will be something that is an Order of Magnitude bigger than anything we've done in stock KSP before.

And it also sounds really cool

Edited March 7, 2023 by Maria Sirona
Fixed double "voyage"
General Contact Unit So… Come Here Often?
Aspire II because of the inevitable shape.  Aspire I is in KSP1 already, just much smaller.

Failure 1

As in there will be at least ONE mission ending detail I missed in the design phase.

I'm very conflicted about names, but I have plenty of ideas. Druyan, to be accompanied by Sagan. Also, Dahlia. Maybe something like Long Memory. Definitely a few other references to sci-fi I like, and for a more simple one, Weight.
If the default is now really "Default name - #", the "Untitled Spacecraft 1"suddenly becomes an interesting name for a first ship doing something.

Obviously, the purpose of the interstellar travel is to harvest spice, so I'm going to name my fleet appropriately.

  • Thyme Traveler
  • Sage Advice
  • Mint Condition
  • Oregano Trail
  • Mustard Cutter
  • Big Dill

Since I have a compulsive tendency to name things with terrible puns based on their destination and purpose (ie: one way trip to Duna could be = I Duna think you'll come back, Moho space station could be = Mohome away from home) I will have to wait and see, since it will depend on the names of the planets and star systems.
My first interstellar craft will be called Outbound Flight in honor of the Star Wars Legends story surrounding it.

The Pipe Dream. 

(This Neanderthal Gamer has only gotten past Kerbin's moons twice).
The Hail Mary...  Oh no, wait; that's taken.

Thread moved to KSP 2 Discussion.

I shall call my first interstellar vessel the Half Safe.
